lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Sparks won the W.N.B.A. draft lottery yesterday at the league’s office in New York for the No. 1 pick in the 2008 draft.The date of the draft, usually after the Women’s Final Four, has not been determined.The Chicago Sky will pick second, followed by the Minnesota Lynx. Atlanta, an expansion team added to the Eastern Conference last week, was automatically awarded the No. 4 pick. The Houston Comets will pick fifth, with the Washington Mystics sixth.The Sparks and Minnesota finished tied for the league’s worst record last season, 10-24.The remaining draft order was based on team record, with the Liberty, the Seattle Storm, the Connecticut Sun and the Sacramento Monarchs rounding out the top 10.
